aicpa-topic.title: Appendix B — Schedule of Changes Made to the Text From the Previous Edition

body.p: This appendix is nonauthoritative and is included for informational purposes only.

Entries in the following table reflect current numbering, lettering (including that in appendix names), and character designations that resulted from the renumbering/reordering that occurred in the updating of this guide.

entry.p: Reference
Change
General

Guide content included in "Guidance Update" boxes within the chapters have been updated to appropriately reflect guidance not yet effective as of the date of the guide. See the preface of this guide for more explanation.
General
References to "Pending Content" have been updated in accordance with the FASB Accounting Standards Codification © (ASC).
General
Editorial changes, including rephrasing, have been made in this guide to improve readability, where necessary.
Revised for passage of time.
Revised to reflect issuance of SEC Release No. 34-96930, Shortening the Securities Transaction Settlement Cycle.
Revised to provide further understanding of digital assets, not related to an issuance of new authoritative guidance.
Footnote 14 in paragraph 1.148
Added to provide a link to a practice aid developed by the AICPA Digital Assets Working Group.
Footnote 15 in paragraph 1.149
Added to provide a link to investor information regarding digital assets on the FINRA website.
Paragraphs 2.02, 2.05, and 2.08
Revised to provide further understanding of broker-dealer records, not related to an issuance of new authoritative guidance.

Added reference to discussion that reflects the issuance of SEC Release No. 34-96034, Electronic Recordkeeping Requirements for Broker-Dealers, Security-Based Swap Dealers, and Major Security-Based Swap Participants.
Revised to reflect issuance of SEC Release No. 34-96930, Shortening the Securities Transaction Cycle.
Revised for the passage of time.
Footnote 7 in paragraph 2.41
Added to reflect issuance of amendments to FINRA Rule 2231, Customer Account Statements.
Paragraphs 2.166–.167 and 2.169
Added to reflect issuance of SEC Release No. 34-96034.
Revised to provide further understanding of Form 1099-B, not related to an issuance of new authoritative guidance.
Footnote 1 in heading of chapter 3
Added reference related to regulation of digital assets.
Footnote 2 in paragraph 3.04
Revised to provide further understanding of the definition of a public business entity, not related to an issuance of new authoritative guidance.
Footnote 8 in paragraph 3.07
Revised to reflect amendments to FINRA Rule 2231.
Footnote 9 in paragraph 3.08 and paragraphs 3.09 and 3.11
Revised for the passage of time.
Revised to provide further understanding of excess margin calculation requirements under FINRA rules, not related to an issuance of new authoritative guidance.
Revised to provide further understanding of special reserve bank accounts for the exclusive benefit of customers, not related to an issuance of new authoritative guidance.
Footnote 19 in paragraph 3.41
Added to provide further understanding of notification requirements of material weaknesses for broker-dealers, not related to an issuance of new authoritative guidance.
Revised to provide further understanding of the Net Capital Rule, not related to an issuance of new authoritative guidance.
Revised to provide further understanding of customer debits includable in the customer reserve formula under SEC Rule 15c3-1, not related to issuance of new authoritative guidance.
Former paragraph 3.62
Deleted, see paragraph 3.41.
Revised to provide further understanding of maintenance margin regulations, including cash payment requirements, under Regulation T.
Footnote 28 in paragraph 3.77
Added to provide a link to Regulation T requirements on the FINRA website.
Footnote 29 in paragraph 3.80
Revised to provide a link to Rule 4210, Margin Requirements, on the FINRA website.
Footnote 30 in paragraph 3.81
Added to reflect issuance of amendments to FINRA Rule 2231.
Revised to provider further understanding of Internal Control Over Compliance as defined in Rule 17a-5, not related to the issuance of new authoritative guidance.
Revised for the passage of time.
Revised to provide further understanding of the accountant’s qualification requirements under Regulation S-X and PCAOB rules, not related to issuance of new authoritative guidance.

Revised to provide further understanding of information required for the Statement Regarding Independent Public Accountant Under Rule 17a-5(f)(2), not related to issuance of new authoritative guidance.
Revised to provide further understanding of Rule 17a-5(f)(3) notifications (replacement of accountant), not related to an issuance of new authoritative guidance.
Revised to provide further understanding of the compliance requirements for dually registered SEC broker-dealers, not related to an issuance of new authoritative guidance.
Revised to provide further understanding of FINRA filing requirements for the FOCUS Report, not related to an issuance of new authoritative guidance.
Paragraphs 3.142–.147
Revised to provide further understanding of the filing requirements for the annual audited financial report and supplementary schedules, not related to an issuance of new authoritative guidance.
Footnote 49 in paragraph 3.147
Revised to provide further understanding of the conditions for the 30-day filing extension for smaller broker-dealers, not related to the issuance of new authoritative guidance.
Footnote 50 in paragraph 3.149
Added to provide further understanding of the requirements for requesting confidential treatment of EDGAR filings, not related to an issuance of new authoritative guidance.
Paragraph 3.150
Revised to provide further understanding of the filing requirements of exchanges, clearing organizations and other entities, not related to an issuance of new authoritative guidance.
Revised to provide further understanding of filings required by state regulatory agencies

Revised to provide further understanding of the requirements for filing financial statements with the SEC and the self-regulatory organizations of which the broker-dealer is a member, not related to an issuance of new authoritative guidance.
Revised for the passage of time.
Revised to provide further understanding of the scope of chapter 4, not related to an issuance of new authoritative guidance.
Revised to provide further understanding of management’s role in establishing and maintaining internal control, not related to an issuance of new authoritative guidance.
Revised to provide further understanding of operational risk in processing broker-dealer transactions, not related to an issuance of new authoritative guidance.
Revised to provide further understanding of information and communication controls, not related to an issuance of new authoritative guidance.
Revised to provide further understanding of information systems, not related to an issuance of new authoritative guidance.
Revised to provide further understanding of application controls, not related to an issuance of new authoritative guidance.
Revised to provide further understanding of general controls, not related to an issuance of new authoritative guidance.
Revised to provide further understanding of control and monitoring activities for new accounts, not related to an issuance of new authoritative guidance.
Revised to provide further understanding of control and monitoring activities related to sales activities, not related to an issuance of new authoritative guidance.
Revised to provide further understanding of control and monitoring activities related to the extension of credit to customers, not related to an issuance of new authoritative guidance.
Revised to provide further understanding of control and monitoring activities related to underwriting activities, not related to an issuance of new authoritative guidance.
Revised to provide further understanding of control and monitoring activities related to commissions, not related to an issuance of new authoritative guidance.
Revised to provide further understanding of control and monitoring activities related to repo and reverse repo agreements, not related to an issuance of new authoritative guidance.
Revised to provide further understanding of valuation techniques under FASB ASC 820, Fair Value Measurement, not related to an issuance of new authoritative guidance.
Footnote 3 in paragraph 5.59
Added to reflect the issuance of SEC Release No. 34-96930, Shortening the Securities Transaction Cycle.
Paragraph 5.66 and footnote 9 in paragraph 5.82
Revised to provide further understanding of the impact of customers’ fractional share interests on the financial statements, not related to an issuance of new authoritative guidance.
Revised to provide further understanding of the definition of a public business entity, not related to an issuance of new authoritative guidance.
Footnote 1 in paragraph 6.01
Revised to provide further understanding of the presentation of comprehensive income under FASB ASC 220, not related to an issuance of new authoritative guidance.

Revised to provide further understanding of the requirements under SEC Rule 17a-5(d) for disclosing material differences between net capital and reserve requirement computations, not related to an issuance of new authoritative guidance.
Revised to provide further understanding of the SEC requirement to provide a statement of changes in subordinated borrowings, not related to an issuance of new authoritative guidance.

Revised to provide further understanding of the required form and content of supplementary schedules required to be filed with the audited financial statements, not related to an issuance of new authoritative guidance.
Revised to provide further understanding of the requirements for disclosure of security positions under SEC Rule 15c3-3, not related to an issuance of new authoritative guidance.
Revised to provide further understanding of deferred dealer commissions and concessions, not related to an issuance of new authoritative guidance.
Revised to provide further understanding of the types of estimates often included in broker-dealers' financial statements, not related to an issuance of new authoritative guidance.
Revised to provide further understanding of the definition of a public business entity, not related to an issuance of new authoritative guidance.
Revised for passage of time.
Revised for passage of time.
